net.sf.prefixedproperties.spring

Class PrefixedPropertyOverrideConfigurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.core.io.support.PropertiesLoaderSupport
      • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyResourceConfigurer
        • org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyOverrideConfigurer
          • net.sf.prefixedproperties.spring.PrefixedPropertyOverrideConfigurer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.config.BeanFactoryPostProcessor, org.springframework.core.Ordered, org.springframework.core.PriorityOrdered

    @ManagedResource(value="prefixedproperties:name=PrefixedPropertyOverrideConfigurer")
public class PrefixedPropertyOverrideConfigurer
extends org.springframework.beans.factory.config.PropertyOverrideConfigurer
    The PrefixedPropertyOverrideConfigurer behaves the same as PropertyOverrideConfigurer with the difference that you can. To configure the default prefix you can use the following methods: setEnvironmentFactory(EnvironmentFactory)
    setDefaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey(String)
    setDefaultPrefix(String)
    The usage of the methods will be in the same order as above.

      • setDefaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey

        public void setDefaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey(String defaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey)
        Sets this method to specify a system property to be used as an environment. The value of the property will be used for setting the default prefix. PrefixedProperties.setDefaultPrefix(String)
        Parameters:
        defaultPrefixSystemPropertyKey - the new ddefault prefix system property key

      • setFileEncoding

        public void setFileEncoding(String encoding)
        Set the encoding to use for parsing properties files.

        Default is none, using the java.util.Properties default encoding.

        Only applies to classic properties files, not to XML files.

        Overrides:
        setFileEncoding in class org.springframework.core.io.support.PropertiesLoaderSupport
        Parameters:
        encoding - the new file encoding
        See Also:
        PropertiesPersister.load(java.util.Properties, java.io.InputStream)

      • setIgnoreResourceNotFound

        public void setIgnoreResourceNotFound(boolean ignoreResourceNotFound)
        Set if failure to find the property resource should be ignored.

        "true" is appropriate if the properties file is completely optional. Default is "false".

        Overrides:
        setIgnoreResourceNotFound in class org.springframework.core.io.support.PropertiesLoaderSupport
        Parameters:
        ignoreResourceNotFound - the new ignore resource not found

        public void setLocation(org.springframework.core.io.Resource location)
        Set a location of a properties file to be loaded.

        Can point to a classic properties file or to an XML file that follows JDK 1.5's properties XML format.
